Detailed Description

Submits a add player (account) to the administration site.

Definition at line 147 of file curlplayeradd.cpp.

bool RainbruRPG::Network::Ident::CurlPlayerAdd::controlBefore (  )  [protected, virtual]

Test the posted data before submit the added player.

We must test :

  • If the name already exists
  • If the pwd isn't empty
  • If the timestamp is'nt empty
  • If the mail already exists

Returns:
true if the operation is successfull, false if it failed

bool RainbruRPG::Network::Ident::CurlSubmitForm::perform (  )  [virtual, inherited]

void RainbruRPG::Network::Ident::CurlInterface::setCustomErrorMessage ( const char *  msg  )  [protected, inherited]

Set a new custom error message.

Only one custom error message can be set, so the second time you call this, a warning log is sent but the message is not modified.

Parameters:
msg The new custom error message
See also:
getCustomErrorMessage()

Definition at line 159 of file curlinterface.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Network::Ident::CurlSubmitForm::setCustomPost ( const char *  key,
const char *  value 
) [inherited]

Used to post some custom key and value.

This method is used to add a key and a value at the same time. If you know the key does not exist, call this. It simply call CurlPostedData::addKey(const char*) and CurlPostedData::setValue(const char* key, const char* val) with the given parameters.

Parameters:
key The key to add
value The password
See also:
CurlPostedData

Used to add a key/value pair to post.

Member Data Documentation

const char* RainbruRPG::Network::Ident::CurlInterface::customErrorMessage [protected, inherited]

If an error occured during a custom operation, fill in this message.

Do not set this directly. Use setCustomErrorMessage instead which test if a message already exits.

The filename or the url to get.

Definition at line 121 of file curlinterface.h.

long RainbruRPG::Network::Ident::CurlInterface::serverResponse [protected, inherited]

The response of the server to the last perform.

It is the server response : 404 says Page not found... The default value is set in CurlInterface's default constructor : -1. This value indicates that no server action was performed.

First test this value, and if you get -1, see customErrorMessage.
